title.native: ドラゴンクエスト ダイの大冒険

description:
After the defeat of the demon lord Hadlar all of the monsters were unleashed from his evil will and moved to the island of Delmurin to live in peace. Dai is the only human living on the island. Having been raised by the kindly monster Brass, Dai's dream is to grow up to be a hero. He gets to become one when Hadlar is resurrected and the previous hero, Avan, comes to train Dai to help in the battle. But Hadlar, announcing that he now works for an even more powerful demon lord, comes to kill Avan. To save his students Avan uses a Self-Sacrifice spell to attack, but is unable to defeat Hadlar. When it seems that Dai and Avan's other student Pop are doomed a mark appears on Dai's forehead and he suddenly gains super powers and is able to fend off Hadlar. The two students then go off on a journey to avenge Avan and bring peace back to the world.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

node.description:
[Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/gilbertobaroli/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/gilberto_baroli/) | [Facebook 1](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.9) | [Facebook 2](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli) | [Facebook 3](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.5) | [Facebook 4](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.7)

Gilberto Pereira Baroli is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and translator. He is married to [Rosa Maria Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/180909/), father of [Hermes Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/100069/), [Luciana Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/106520/) and Hiram Baroli, stepfather of [Letícia Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/100136/) and grandfather of [Bruna Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/274698/), [Caio Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/262448/), Hiram Baroli Filho and [Gustavo Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/341902/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Papa Smurf (The Smurfs 1981 [1st dub], Les Schtroumpfs 2021, The Smurfs and the Magic Flute [2nd dub], My Smurfy Valentine, Smurfily Ever After [2nd dub], The Smurfs Christmas Special [2nd dub] and The Smurfs The Legend of Smurfy Hollow)
- Aurelion Sol, The Star Forger (League of Legends)
- Yoninin Dokussai (2nd voice - eps 17-50; Sekai Ninja Sen Jiraiya)
- Elementor (Max Steel franchise)
- Richard Harrison (Pawn Stars)
- Commander Yui Ibuki (Dengeki Sentai Changeman)
- Park Rick Marshall (1st dub; The Land of The Lost)
- Commander Sanjuurou Sugata (Hikari Sentai Maskman)
- Rampage / Protoform X (Beast Wars)
- Comissioner Francis "Frank" Reagan (2nd voice - 13th season onwards; Blue Bloods)
- Sr. Bullet (Mullet Mad Jack)
- Three-Eyed Raven (2nd voice - 6th season; Game of Thrones)
- Fulgor (Masters of the Universe: Revolution)
- Donkey Xote (Remigio Globus)
- Hades (Impérios AD)
- General Themes (Don't Look Up)
!~

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/digofirmo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RodrigoFirmo6) | [Facebook 1](https://www.facebook.com/rodrigofirmoartista/) | [Facebook 2](https://www.facebook.com/rodrigo.firmo.3) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@digofirmo/)

Rodrigo Firmo de Freitas is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer, musician, musical director, and dubbing director. He is the son of former voice actor Mário Lúcio de Freitas and younger brother of Karina Firmo.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Aiden Romero / Ninja Steel Gold (1st voice; Power Rangers: Ninja Steel)
- Skjöldr (God of War Ragnarök)
- Ganke Lee (Spider-Man: Miles Morales and Marvel's Spider-Man 2)
- Raymond "Skizzo" Sarkoski (Days Gone)
- Heath Buckland (Nowhere Boys)
- Bryan Cranna (Outlander)
- Tad (1st voice - 2nd-4th season; Star vs. The Forces of Evil)
- Gideon / Morpheus / Aesop / Son (Once Upon a Time)
- Luis (LEGO Marvel's Avengers)
- Shaun Taylor-Corbett (Hi-5 EUA)
- Erdoğan Yaşaner (Fatmagül'un Suçu Ne?)
- Franco Herrera Fuentes (Pasión y Poder)
- Fırat Demiralp (Hercai)
- Serch (El Dandy)
- El-Ahrairah (Watership Down 2018)
- Ralph Macchio (How I Met Your Mother)
- Tommy Murphy (Jinxed)
!~

[Website](http://www.ivodepalma.it/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ivodepalma) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCci9goBOT9biFM6cvrdrlkg)

An Italian voice actor, ADR director and dialogue writer, mostly known for his roles as [Seiya of Pegasus](https://anilist.co/character/2285/), [Go Kato](https://anilist.co/character/22101/) (Mirko), [Might Guy](https://anilist.co/character/307/), [Kaede Rukawa](https://anilist.co/character/311/), [Jotaro Kujo](https://anilist.co/character/4003/) and [Akira Fudou](https://anilist.co/character/2456/) in the OVAs.

Giorgio Vincenzo Vanni is an Italian singer and song-writer.  Vanni is well known for performing theme songs of Italian dubs of Japanese and American animated TV series.   The dubbed Italian songs he sings usually are not covers of the Japanese songs but tend to be newly written songs for the Italian dub of the anime.   (Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%8E%E3%82%84%E3%81%BE%E3%81%93%E3%81%86%E3%81%84%E3%81%A1) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koichi_Sugiyama)

Kouichi Sugiyama is a Japanese composer, conductor, and orchestrator.

Sugiyama is known for composing the music for the Dragon Quest video game series, along with several other games, anime, film, and television shows. Classically trained, Sugiyama is considered a major inspiration for other Japanese game music composers. He is also a council member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers, and Publishers (JASRAC), board member of the Japan Institute for National Fundamentals, and honorary chairman of the Japanese Backgammon Society. In 2020, he was named a Person of Cultural Merit by the Japanese government.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Atsushi Kido is a producer affiliated with Toei Animation.
He has worked as both a story writer for manga and anime. He graduated from Meiji University.
Nobutaka Nishizawa was a director, animator, and producer. He worked for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) from 1964 to 2000.
Hideyuki Tanaka is a sound director for anime and the founder and representative director of sound production studio Audio Tanaka.

Shibata is a japanese animator and animatior director currently working at Toei Animation. He is the father of the mangaka [Yuusaku Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/107002) and [Hikari Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/127324).
Nobutaka Nishizawa was a director, animator, and producer. He worked for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) from 1964 to 2000.

**Hayato Matsuo** is a Japanese arranger, composer, orchestrator and musician. Hayato is a composer, arranger and orchestrator for both the video game industry and the anime industry. He has worked on titles such as Front Mission 3, Final Fantasy XII, the Shenmue Series, and Magic Knight Rayearth. Inspired by his mother, who was a piano teacher, he graduated from the music composition department of Tokyo University of the Arts. While in college, he composed for the band G-Clef, and occasionally stood in for the members of the band. Upon graduating, he went to work under Sugiyama Kouichi, the composer of the popular Dragon Quest video game series, arranging his pieces for Dragon Quest anime shows and soundtracks. In 1991, Hayato began to work as a video game music composer himself, writing the score to Master of Monsters. Over the next few years, he worked as an independent composer on several games and anime series, including Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen. In 1995, he joined the independent music composition group Imagine. He has continued since then to compose and orchestrate works for over 20 games and anime shows, as well as the television show Kamen Rider 555, and a few pieces a part of original albums.
